result.name: nematode-assemblages-from-trawling-experiments-at-two-stations-in-the-southern-north-1999-2000
result.notes:
Data is presented as counts of nematode worms present in samples obtained from 
two locations in the southern North Sea, the Western Mud Hole and the 
Botney Cut. These data are results of trawling experiments conducted from 
October 1999 to November 2000. Samples were collected from impact site A and 
an untrawled control site B at both locations.

Data including the biomass and abiotic factors of the sampling locations are 
also available.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Nematode assemblages from trawling experiments at two stations in the southern North Sea, 1999-2000

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
